intro: Lasiosiphon occidentalis, commonly known as the western lasiosiphon, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its leaves are lanceolate and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The flowers, which range in color from white to pale blue, bloom in late spring to early summer.
